content.text: Several new features have been added to the Eliza project. Users can now view and edit memories of an agent (PR #3954), clear logs through a new method and API (PR #3974), and benefit from documentation versioning (PR #3963).

Multiple bug fixes have been implemented, including fixing a missing 'await' for tweet scraping (PR #3960), resolving issues with the plugin-local-ai (PR #3953), improving log display and APIs (PR #3971), fixing AI writer rerender issues (PR #3969), showing thoughts messages in real time (PR #3967), refactoring bubble layout (PR #3965), and correcting a button label (PR #3964).

Other improvements include support for any custom embedding server (PR #3958), development of V2 documentation (PR #3951), simplification of connection status (PR #3973), and client knowledge management enhancements (PR #3950).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new features and improvements have been proposed to the elizaOS/eliza repository through recent pull requests:

- PR #3961 adds system prompt functionality, contributed by nicky-ru
- PR #3957 introduces a work-in-progress client room feature, developed by tcm390
- PR #3954 implements the ability to view and edit memories of an agent, created by wtfsayo
- PR #3962 merges core changes to the repository, submitted by nusk0
- PR #3963 adds documentation versioning capabilities, contributed by madjin
- PR #3976 improves test coverage for plugin storage S3, developed by ai16z-demirix
- PR #3977 fixes an issue with storing PostgreSQL connection URLs in the global configuration, submitted by 0xbbjoker

These pull requests represent ongoing development efforts to enhance the functionality, documentation, and reliability of the eliza project.

categories.title: Recent Issues in elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #3952: Users are experiencing Discord messages disappearing randomly, as reported by user D3nii.

2. Issue #3956: A preflight check for V2 has been submitted by user jmikedupont2.

3. Issue #3955: An issue related to 'opus.node' has been reported by jmikedupont2.

4. Issue #3972: User NBFinanceTech has reported an issue with raw newLine characters appearing in tweets.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From March 16-17, 2025, there were 8 new pull requests with 5 merged, 3 new issues, and 14 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (March 17-18, 2025) with 13 new pull requests (9 merged), 1 new issue, and 10 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with consistent contributor engagement.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
